act() - Method in class Die
Act - do whatever the Die wants to do.
act() - Method in class GameBoard
Depending on the game's state, determines what the GameBoard does during each frame or cycle of the `act` method
act() - Method in class PlayerPiece
The `act` method for the PlayerPiece is fairly simple since most of the game logic is handled by the GameBoard class; but we will use the `act` method to set the opacity (transparency) of the object depending on whether or not the piece is moveable

GameBoard - Class in Unnamed Package
The physical game board for Connor Floyd's "The Royal Echoes of Ur" game (NOTE: this class is also used as a "level manager" for managing the game logic, game state, etc.)

isEchoSpace() - Method in class Space
 
isMoveable() - Method in class PlayerPiece
Getter (accessor) method for retrieving this player piece's `moveable` state value (true or false) NOTE: While it is a common Java convention to name "getter" methods by concatenating the prefix `get` with the name of the corresponding instance variable (while obeying camelCase rules), it is usually preferable (more readable) to use the prefix `is` when the corresponding instance variable is of type `boolean`
isOccupiedByPieceForPlayerIndex(int) - Method in class Space
This getter (accessor) method returns true if this space is occupied by a piece belonging to the player corresponding to playerIndex
isSafeSpace() - Method in class Space
This "getter" method returns `true` if this space is a safe space

M

makeAllPiecesMoveableAgainForPlayerIndex(int) - Method in class GameBoard
"Turns on" (makes moveable) all of pieces for the given player (specified by `playerIndex`) at the conclusion of that player's turn
moveSelectedPieceIntoGoalZoneForPlayerIndex(int, PlayerPiece) - Method in class GameBoard
"Helper" method (here called by handleSelectedPieceForPlayerIndex) to move the selected playerPiece's SPRITE into the goal zone.
moveSelectedPieceOntoTargetSpaceForPlayerIndex(int, PlayerPiece) - Method in class GameBoard
helper method (called by handleSelectedPieceForPlayerIndex) for moving a piece into a target space that is not the goal

PlayerPiece - Class in Unnamed Package
Represents a player's game piece -- player 1's pieces (for player index 0) are straight-faced, player 2's pieces (for player index 1) are smiling
PlayerPiece(int, int, int) - Constructor for class PlayerPiece
Initializes a newly-instantiated PlayerPiece object

R

resetCapturedPieceOnBoardAndReplaceWithSelectedPieceForPlayerIndex(int, PlayerPiece) - Method in class GameBoard
"Helper" method (here called by `moveSelectedPieceOntoTargetSpaceForPlayerIndex`) for handling the capture of an opposing player's piece

updateGoalCountForPlayerIndex(int) - Method in class GameBoard
For the given playerIndex, checks to see how many of that player's pieces have been moved into that goal zone at the end of that player's movement path
